statements: SELECT * FROM stress_test_scenarios;
SELECT scenario_name, estimated_loss FROM stress_test_scenarios WHERE stress_level > 5;
SELECT * FROM stress_test_scenarios WHERE estimated_loss < 1000 ORDER BY stress_level DESC;
SELECT scenario_id, scenario_name FROM stress_test_scenarios WHERE stress_level = 3;
SELECT MAX(estimated_loss) AS max_loss FROM stress_test_scenarios;
SELECT * FROM stress_test_scenarios WHERE estimated_loss > 1000 ORDER BY stress_level DESC;
SELECT scenario_id, scenario_name FROM stress_test_scenarios WHERE stress_level BETWEEN 4 AND 7;
SELECT * FROM stress_test_scenarios WHERE scenario_name LIKE 'S%' OR scenario_name LIKE '%t';
SELECT scenario_id, stress_level, estimated_loss FROM stress_test_scenarios WHERE stress_level > 5 ORDER BY estimated_loss ASC;
SELECT scenario_id, stress_level, scenario_name FROM stress_test_scenarios WHERE stress_level = 3 AND estimated_loss < 5000;
SELECT * FROM stress_tests
SELECT test_name, test_date FROM stress_tests
SELECT test_id, test_name, test_date, num_iterations FROM stress_tests WHERE num_iterations > 100
SELECT test_id, test_name, test_date, num_iterations FROM stress_tests ORDER BY test_date DESC
SELECT test_id, test_name, risk_type, risk_level FROM stress_tests JOIN risk_management ON stress_tests.test_id = risk_management.test_id
SELECT * FROM stress_tests;
SELECT test_name, test_date FROM stress_tests WHERE num_iterations > 1000;
SELECT test_name, num_iterations FROM stress_tests ORDER BY num_iterations DESC;
SELECT test_name, COUNT(*) AS num_risks FROM stress_tests JOIN risk_management ON stress_tests.test_id = risk_management.test_id GROUP BY test_name HAVING num_risks > 5;
SELECT risk_type, risk_level FROM risk_management JOIN stress_tests ON stress_tests.test_id = risk_management.test_id WHERE test_date > '2022-01-01';
SELECT * FROM StressTests;
SELECT test_name, test_result FROM StressTests WHERE test_duration > 100;
SELECT test_name, test_duration FROM StressTests ORDER BY test_duration DESC;
SELECT * FROM RiskFactors WHERE factor_weight > 0.5;
SELECT factor_name, factor_weight, factor_description FROM RiskFactors ORDER BY factor_weight ASC;
SELECT * FROM StressTests WHERE test_duration > 60 ORDER BY test_name DESC;
SELECT test_name, test_duration, test_result FROM StressTests WHERE test_result = 'Pass' ORDER BY test_duration ASC, test_name DESC;
SELECT t.test_name, r.result_value, r.result_date FROM StressTests t JOIN TestResults r ON t.test_id = r.test_id WHERE r.result_value > 0.5;

SELECT t.test_name, r.factor_description FROM StressTests t JOIN TestResults r ON t.test_id = r.test_id JOIN RiskFactors f ON r.factor_id = f.factor_id WHERE f.factor_weight < 0.8 ORDER BY t.test_name ASC;

SELECT t.test_name, f.factor_name, r.result_value FROM StressTests t JOIN TestResults r ON t.test_id = r.test_id JOIN RiskFactors f ON r.factor_id = f.factor_id WHERE t.test_duration < 120 AND r.result_value >= 0.5 ORDER BY r.result_value DESC;
SELECT * FROM RiskAssessments;
SELECT test_name, test_date FROM StressTests;
SELECT factor_name, factor_weight FROM RiskFactors ORDER BY factor_weight DESC;
SELECT scenario_name, scenario_result FROM TestScenarios WHERE scenario_result > 50;
SELECT test_name, test_description, test_date FROM StressTests WHERE test_date >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT * FROM StressTests;
SELECT test_name, test_description FROM StressTests ORDER BY test_date DESC;
SELECT scenario_name, scenario_result FROM TestScenarios WHERE scenario_result > 100;
SELECT factor_name, factor_weight FROM RiskFactors WHERE factor_weight < 3.50 ORDER BY factor_weight ASC;

SELECT t.test_name, s.scenario_name, r.factor_name FROM RiskAssessments ra JOIN StressTests t ON ra.test_id = t.test_id JOIN TestScenarios s ON ra.scenario_id = s.scenario_id JOIN RiskFactors r ON ra.factor_id = r.factor_id;
SELECT * FROM stress_test_scenario;
SELECT scenario_name, stress_level FROM stress_test_scenario;
SELECT scenario_name, stress_level FROM stress_test_scenario WHERE stress_level > 5;
SELECT * FROM stress_test_scenario WHERE risk_factor < 0.5;
SELECT scenario_name, risk_factor FROM stress_test_scenario ORDER BY risk_factor DESC;
SELECT * FROM stress_test_scenario WHERE stress_level > 5 ORDER BY risk_factor DESC LIMIT 10
SELECT scenario_name, risk_factor FROM stress_test_scenario WHERE scenario_id BETWEEN 100 AND 200
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_scenarios FROM stress_test_scenario WHERE risk_factor < 0.5
SELECT * FROM stress_test_scenario WHERE scenario_name LIKE '%Scenario%' ORDER BY scenario_id ASC LIMIT 5
SELECT stress_level, COUNT(*) AS num_scenarios FROM stress_test_scenario GROUP BY stress_level HAVING num_scenarios > 3 ORDER BY stress_level
